content.description: Work through a low crux to thin middle section, followed by a juggy upper section with a powerful finish.
content.location: This climb starts below a low roof behind a burned tree.

content.description: Obvious prow.  Funky bouldering on a prow with some ninja moves also.
content.location: On the prominent prow just to the right of "Dream of Least Weasels."

content.description:
A wildly different extension to Kashmir.

Climb the slab past the anchor and clip high off a large flake. Surf a few big flat edges, cross, thug left, and hike pockets filled with beautiful calcite crystals to the top. Thugging left can be skipped! Faucet hands discovered a great straight up variation. Great rock climbing and athletic movement.

Bob and Ed named the original line after the Zeppelin song in 1999. Felt good to push this to the top 21 years later. Bagging the extension will allow you to travel all time and space!
content.location: Extension to Kashmir which is right of a large corner.

content.description: Thin climbing up an initial arete, then onto the face with some reachy moves.  A great rest half way up so you can shake out nice.  Cruxes getting to the second bolt and off the third bolt.  Fun, well protected and keeps your attention.
content.location: Immediately around the corner left of Cheaper Than Religion.

content.description:
Hand crack through bulge, leading to a stem corner finish.  This is not your standard Sinks route, and really adds some diversity to the area.  You can also continue past the chains to finish on

Cheaper than Religion

for one more bulge.
content.location: This is an obvious handcrack that starts just around the corner and to the right of the "Kashmir" corner.

content.description: A long sport route, crux off the second bolt with a semi-dynamic lunge to good incut edge above a small roof.  Follow bolt line up a slab to an interesting pocketed bulge at the top.  Quite a lot of fun and mostly 5.8.
content.protection: lots of bolts.  Fixx rings for anchor.
content.location: Walk west from Screaming Trees, etc. past a gulley with a short wall at its base to a tall section of cliff.  Just to the right of a prominent hand crack, route begins in a small corner, bolts leading up the face forever.

climbs.name: The Boy with the Aluminum Tail

content.description: Climb an interesting micro arete feature to a baffling, thin crux. Quest pockets that get progressively steeper until you reach the "roof". Climb up and left on hard crimps, or make large moves using holds to the right.
content.location: Left of the large crack system.

climbs.name: The Boy with a Knack for Crack
climbs.fa: Bob and Ed on gear. Bolted for the masses by TJS

content.description:
Great moderate crack climb with plenty of face holds and stemming opportunities.

I'm guessing Bob and Ed climbed this corner on bongs and 2x4's to install the original Kashmir anchor?
